intro: Spergula cerviana, commonly known as the meadow sedge, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and similar grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Spergula cerviana is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
